Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably an amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of horse and rider to right (part of rider’s chest with dot rosette in added white for nipple, left arm with two faded white lines and right thigh with two faded white lines; horse’s head with added red in nostril, white teeth, white dots for bridle, bit and reins, neck and part of shoulder remaining).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.14.4)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 20, pl. VII, no. 4)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 139, no. F5)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.254, no.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.033) (Phase 1)
